reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our fourth stay (for our 10th anniversay), our third in a hard to beat ocean view private pool villa with beach view across the lawns from the front terrace and a large truly private Balinese pool in the rear along with a raised dining deck with views to the ocean. Each villa and its surrounding walls are beautifully built of coral with a very royal Balinese style and feel. It may be 30 years old but you'd never know it as it is maintained in pristine condition, we think it is the most under rated of the 5+ star hotels in Bali and we have stayed at most. It is unassuming and understated from the road but once inside it is just a wonderful haven with personal service at your fingertips. Service is not frenetic and over the top like the Ritz Carlton it is just unobtrusively there when and as you want it. The beachfront breakfast is a highlight as is the fine dining restaurant. You can walk out into Seminyak to cheap eating if you want & the hip Ku de Ta is next door etc. Granted it is not cheap but by comparison it offers fantastic luxury, quality & value against the others.
reviews.title: Always outstanding
A really lovely hotel
reviews.text: We went onto the serene Oberoi Lombok for a second stay (see our review) then back to the Ritz Carlton in Bali for a couple of days (huge, isolated from Jimbaran so you are captive, expensive, and nice enough but definitely not in the same class as the Oberois).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 9th visit to Bali and our first to Seminyak. The Oberoi is a lovely classy hotel with an old fashioned feel. I enjoyed having my sunglasses cleaned each day! We were surprised on arrival to be told we were entilted to a free buffet meal with Balinese dancing - we went to the Barbecue buffet and it was one of the best buffets ever - the quality of the food was exceptional (I had to try 3 different desserts!). The hotel restaurant was very expensive and a bottle of wine was about £40 minimum so we ate in Seminyak at night (the Greek restaurant was very lively). Alternatively the restaurant 5 minutes along the beach - Gado Gado - has exceptional food at both lunch and dinner (different menus at each) and you can take your own wine - bought at very reasonable prices from the wine shop in Seminyak - and pay corkage. The horse riding on the beach was fantastic. Be warned about swimming in the sea though - there are serious rip tides. People were ignoring the warning flags and swimming anyway and sadly we saw 2 people drown.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay... Minakshi & Sunil Goil , Noida

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just come back from a wonderful holiday ( 6 nights ) at Oberoi Bali to celebrate our 25th anniversary. The Oberoi hospitality is not unknown to us but this place overshadowed the others. Since the time we entered the gates till the time of departure , we felt truly welcome all the time. We have travelled globally and I must confess that we could not find any fault during our stay. We rented an ocean view villa ( without pool ) which was a fantastic place to stay . The whole place has been built in traditional Balinese architecture which was a good change. A very special mention to the staff , always friendly , pleasant and hard working and always remembered to address us by name. The restaurants , poolside etc. is all overlooking the ocean . Had superb breakfast every morning. Had a wonderful surprise Romantic dinner on the beach as a gift from our children but ofcourse with the help of the hotel. Situated on the Seminyak beach ,there are lots of interesting restaurants closeby serving the international cuisine. A must go place ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was originally booked by my travel agent in a property down the beach. When I passed the Oberoi, however, I realised I had been cheated. I immediately went to the front desk and booked myself in. I never regretted it. The Oberoi Seminyak is more traditional and conventional than some of the more design hotels on the beach -- which I usually prefer. But what I do like about this hotel is its absolue lack of pretention, the simplicity and classic elegance. It's light yet simple décor focuses on quality and comfort, which is perfect after a long flight. it is also on the end of a stretch of very crowded, popular beach, and has the best beach chairs and umbrellas. I loved it. Sure, Bulgari and Nusa Dua and others are down the beach, and I checked them all out. I love a good hotel and am happy to splurge on my holidays. But this has a particular steady charm the others dont. If I want to stay at a trendy property, I would stay at my own private villa in town (I found one, but won't tell you where), which comes with its own private pool. Now THAT's cool. But if I want to be pampered on the beach, this is the hotel. I always kick off my stay at this hotel which provides a reliable "soft landing". From here, I move on to the ultra modern sophisticated hotels in Ubud, or chill out in one of my remote Villa finds elsewhere (my secrets), but this property never lets me down. Minutes by taxi anywhere in Seminyak, if you can be bothered to leave.
reviews.title: Loved Oberoi in Seminyak

likes.liked: — Centrally located, but still private and exclusive and calm. Great beach views, pool, food, villas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in December during an awful rain storm. However, the room was wonderful, food was great and the hotel was just well run. An example-- during a break in the rain, a bunch of people were leaving the hotel to head out. It ends up they put us with the wrong driver due to the rush. The driver was very nice and so was the car. Nonetheless, the hotel did not charge us and apologized twice. The front desk was great at helping with dinner and excursions. Although the first top hotel in Bali, it does not feel dated. Free computer room, nice gym, nice pool and the room was perfect. The location is great, on the beach and walking distance to the shops of Seminayak. Would stay here again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Idyllic and Relaxing
Awesome
reviews.text: We arranged for the hotel to collect us from the airport. The car was waiting with iced towels and bottled water, which was most welcome after the busy flight from KL.

reviews.title: gorgeous Oberoi
reviews.text: Upon arriving at the property, we felt like royalty. We were given orchid leys and guided to some armchairs on the veranda overlooking the sea. This is not your average check in process. One of the staff then escorted us to our private villa, making sure to point out the amenities such as the restaurants, pools and spa. The villa was amazing, with it's huge private pool and outdoor dining area. Inside was a nicely decorated bedroom and huge bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Oberoi has the reputation of being one of the best hotels in Seminyak. We'd been to Bali a number of times in the past, but had never stayed at the Oberoi. Given the strength and breadth of the 5 star resorts in Bali, our expectations were very high. We left disappointed.
reviews.title: Quality is slipping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side the grounds are fantastic...beautifully manicured and facing out on the beach towards the sunset. The pool setting too was a lovely place to sit and relax. The location is great, close to shopping and next door to Ku De Ta on the beach. In the evenings, our children were surprised to come back to the room to find milk and cookies set out for them.
reviews.title: It really doesn't get better than this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: However the negatives outweighed the positives. When we first arrived, we were given a room that smelled heavily of mildew. We told this to the staff as soon as we entered the room. At first she denied the odor saying that the room smelled fine. When we asked to see/smell another room, she then replied that all of the rooms would smell the same as the same cleaning products were used. Finally she and my wife went off to look for other rooms, but my wife was sent back 30 minutes later having not seen any other rooms. We gave up and went for lunch outside of the hotel. Luckily when we came back they had found another room for us that didn't smell. The decor of the room wasn't spectacular either. While the bathroom was beautiful with a sunken tub and a shower that opened to the outside, the bedroom itself was a bit tatty. It had a woven, rattan like ceiling and furniture made from thick bamboo. Very Balinese, but not luxurious. The last straw for us was the food. The food and drink prices in the hotel are extremely high - higher than one would pay next door at Ku De Ta, and much higher than one would pay at other establishments in Bali. Given the reputation of the hotel, and the prices, we expected the food to be outstanding. It wasn't. Despite a full hotel, there was only one table occupied in the formal dining restaurant. We took this as a sign and instead went for a casual meal in the bar. We went for standard hotel fare - a pizza, a club sandwich, salad and a soup. Unfortunately it was worse than what you'd get a business hotel in other parts of Asia. After one spoonful of soup, my wife stopped eating it. The pizza was essentially a frozen pizza. Given the other, far better and less expensive options nearby, we were very disappointed.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won't be coming back as the experience didn't match the price.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Wow, what a fantastic hotel. It's on a huge plot of land and right on the beach. The rooms are in villas, the bedroom was huge and the bathroom spotlessly clean. The service in the hotel was second to none, we loved the sunglasses cleaning service and being offered a lift in a golf buggy whenever we were walking around. A relaxed breakfast overlooking the ocean was memorable. All in all this was a perfect short break and "decompression stop" en route to Australia.
reviews.title: Just lovely
Its OK...but
reviews.text: Stayed 7 nights ending 23 March 08. Well travelled mid age Aussie couple. Summary: The Oberoi Bali is ok, but only that. You can do much better for what is a top dollar proposition. (i.e we stuffed up mildly!). The staff are great. The setting is great. The standard rooms (called Lanais) are - for the $ - only just 'ok'. Most are garden view and some actually face walls! Some ocean view lanais lack privacy. These rooms - like the whole establishment - are a tad on the tired side, with stupid beds and awkward sunken baths. The villas are as usual a different world altogether....if you must stay there be in a villa. The breakfast setting and food/service was good; the main restuarant service & food was excellent and expensive. Heaps of good quality & value eateries and shops within minutes for ~$2 taxi fares in any event. The clientele were a mixed bunch (nationality, age, & sexual preference) but no sweaty secretaries from Birmingham thanks be. Nice little gym, 3 terminal free internet room, pool is tired & basic (what no swim up bar!?), boogie boards for low beach surf and thats about it mate.

reviews.title: old fashioned luxury
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel after fleeing from the philipines because of the rain. Did not do any checking of the hotel since it was a last minute thing but thought that it being an Oberoi it would be fine.

reviews.title: Reasons to be cheerful...
reviews.text: And indeed it is a great place, no over the top luxury rooms, old fashioned tv's, no trendy interior etc. as you have in soo many of the resorts nowadays but overall feeling of old fashioned luxury and service. Great gardens, lovely swimming pool, very good Spa (book in advance) and small but fine gym. Service was fantastic as you would expect, but you never know. Did not have dinner in the restaurant since we like to go out and see other places as wel, especially with so many nice restaurants in the area (La Luciola, Gado Gado, Ku De Ta, Living Room, Warisan, Hu'u etc.) but lunch and breakfast was very good.

reviews.title: Unbeatable in Bali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have just spent 5 nights at this wonderful hotel, and absolutely loved it. The rooms are superb, clean and very traditional - I especially loved the bathroom, and couldn't choose which to use, the sunken bath or the shower, so used the both. All the staff are wonderful, and I loved having my sunglasses cleaned by the pool, and the complimentary fruit and ice creams throughout the day. The restaurants are great, and breakfast at the Frangipani Cafe is a wonderful experience, with a superb choice of fruits, eggs, wonderful coffee and too much choice. Location is wonderful, with some great restaurants nearby. The Living Room and Ku De Ta are especially good, but don't miss a meal in the a la carte restaurant at the hotel. I could not fault this hotel, and would definitely go back again. We stayed at the Oberoi in Cairo last year, and absolutely loved the experience there too, as the Oberoi Group are synonomous with excellence. An absolute treat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Some of the reviews I had read before I stayed there said that the Oberoi in Seminyak was showing its age. If so, it's ageing very well. It would be difficult to find any fault with this hotel. The rooms and villas are a delight. The location is excellent: right on a stretch of beautiful beach and within 10-15 minutes walking distance of restaurants and shops. The staff is well trained, friendly and helpful. When you stay here try the restaurant Sate Bali; it's just outside the entrance to the hotel, although somewhat hidden behind a market.
reviews.title: An extraordinary experience in Bali
Excellent wedding venue
reviews.text: What is special about this resort is the timeless quality of the resort. For a resort, age is usually a bad thing, at the Oberoi it has the opposite effect for two reasons. One, the resort was built at a time and place when the land prices were not what they are today. Therefore the resort can afford to spread itself out far more than the newer neighbors, more space = more peace. Second, the resort is built of timeless natural materials that look better with age. I heard the resort has not even been renovated once in 30 years - amazing. Having traveled to Bali many times, staying here is truly a special one of a kind experience and one of the best on the entire island.

Greta hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Oberoi from Monday night to Friday night during the week after the U.S. Memorial Day holiday. It was absolutely outstanding in nearly every respect. The hotel staff was incredibly courteous and helpful, from the gentleman who picked us up at the airport to the concierge who arranged our departure. We loved our ocean-view lanai, which felt luxurious by U.S. standards and had an incredibly wonderful, peaceful, romantic feel to it. One tiny quibble was that the wifi/internet was expensive, and not that easy to use, but who really wants to surf the net when you're in Bali? The Oberoi pool and beachfront is fantastic -- the kind of place you can lie for hours (we did) and enjoy their drinks and food. The Oberoi sits on one of Bali's most fabled beaches, and it is quite spectacular. Definintely try to attend one of the dances or performances they put on -- they're well-done and fun. We also took advantage of the Oberoi Spa for a couple of treatments and a yoga class, and used the gym there as well. All were first-rate. We also booked a tour of Ubud through the hotel which wasn't that great; next time, we'll book our own cab and explore on our own. The restaurant was excellent too, especially the breakfasts and lunches, although don't forget to walk around Seminyak to try some of the other places. Bottom line -- you will have an unforgettable and luxurious vacation if you stay at the Oberoi.
